title: Awesome app
text: I love my happy feed. It helps me to remember to look for moments of peace and joy in my life. I can find it even on tough days.  It is a great tool for daily reflection and I love how I can look back through the years. It helps me to stay grounded and grateful. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Amazing concept, great prompts
text: A friend and I looked for an app where we could share daily wonders easily . This is a great one allowing both video, pictures and text. If you pay the app fee, you can load more than one pic a day and see more of your past postings but there is a free version which is fine if you don‚Äôt want downloadable history. The one thing I hope the creators will improve right away is the ability to toggle back and forth between screens more easily. It gets stuck sometimes or just won‚Äôt get to the screen I‚Äôm seeking unless I refresh. It needs work on navigation but other than that, it‚Äôs a little jewel.

title: Fun and Easy
text: Love this app to remind me of the little joys of each day

title: Such a joy
text: I‚Äôve been using Happyfeed for a while, and it is such a quick and easy way for me to capture a moment of gratitude. Been a constant go-to for inspiration and for pausing and appreciating the moment I am in!

title: Good for people with ADHD!
text: I have ADHD and it‚Äôs hard for me to manage time efficiently. I also tend to struggle with focusing on negatives. This app makes it easier for me to point out positives and recognize the good things that happen daily. I love it.

title: Love
text: I love the app, I‚Äôd like more background options for when it shows the streak you‚Äôre on with a photo background.

title: Character Limit/Timestamps/Tags
text:
I would love to not have a character limit so that it feels more like a journal.
I would also love to have a timestamp and having the option to put tags on each log. A search bar would be great as well to filter through logs when wanting to recall a specific memory.

title: Best ever!
text: I have found a picture and a few sentences goes a long way in keeping me positive and focused. Thank you happy feed!

title: Perfect for low effort gratitude journaling!
text: I‚Äôve never kept up with any type of journaling consistently until I started using this app. It‚Äôs so easy to add a picture from your day every day, and the streak counts and memories are really motivating to do so.

title: This app is perfection
text: Thank you to the happy feed team - i wanted an app where i could take a photo a day without all of the baggage of modern social media, and happy feed delivers. Really grateful for this app.

title: Very Helpful

title: THIS APP HAS CHANGED MY LIFE!!!!! FRFR
text:
This app has truly changed my life. It has helped me look at my life and a much more appreciative way and cherish moments that I would forget to otherwise. I had a really unhealthy relationship with social media. This became a healer for that. Because I only see my own life and the beautiful things that I love about my life and I‚Äôm not comparing it to anyone else‚Äôs.

I romanticize my life :)

title: Review
text: I love this app because I can take it with me everywhere.

title: changed my life
text: After watching the movie Soul and realizing I had a sudden deep desire to better appreciate the small wonderful moments in my life, i downloaded this app on a whim. And  4 years later I can honestly say it has changed my life and my perspective of it. I find myself looking for things throughout my day that brought me joy and I notice far more simple little moments than I did before. I love that I can add pictures to my entries and go back and look at what made me happy a year or two or three ago and see how I‚Äôve changed and grown. I have not been completely consistent but I am proud to say I‚Äôve competed 874 days of happyfeed and cannot wait for more! I‚Äôve only ever had good experiences with their customer service and the app has always worked well and without bugs or glitches

title: My favorite app ever
text: This app has gotten me through medical school and now residency. I‚Äôm so grateful to be able to focus on the happy things in the midst of such a challenging season

title: Really Helps!
text: I love using this app it really helps to upgrade your mood. The streaks motivate you to stay consistent. You can join a randomized group which is so fun and inspiring. The flashback moments are an amazing feature as well, constantly reminding you of your good days. I love this app! I‚Äôd love if you weren‚Äôt limited on the amount of daily moments. I really do feel like this helps maintain a more positive mood and outlook

title: The BEST
text: HappyFeed is my favorite app EVER and one of my favorite things to do everyday. I love seeing my memories from over the years each day. It‚Äôs really the best and brings a smile to my often ü•∞ I recommend it to everyone. Thank you for such a wonderful journal of memories!!

title: Love this Journal App
text: It‚Äôs so easy to use! I‚Äôve been using it now for over 760 consecutive days!!!! It‚Äôs my inspiration journey journal. I made a group share with my best friend so we can share our days goals accomplishments etc  it‚Äôs truly a great app

title: Happyfeed makes me happy
text: Love that I can see years of memories.  Especially when I might be having a down day, love looking back and seeing what made me happy one year, two years or even six years ago.  Brings tears to my eyes at times. Makes me laugh out loud too. Thank you Matt for creating HappyFeed. Can‚Äôt go a day without posting.

title: I like it
text: Makes me keep on track little miracles everyday ü´∂üèª

title: Enjoy using Happy Feed for gratitude journaling
text: I‚Äôve been doing gratitude journaling for years. Happy Feed makes it easy. Like the prompts and enjoy ability to add pics.

title: Simple and powerful
text: Easy to use way to gratitude journal. I love looking back at past moments of joy.

title: Small time commitment, big impact
text: I have ADD and can have a difficult time focusing. So I get down and give up on things a lot. But something about this app keeps me coming back daily. I'm on a 29-day streak and can't imagine missing one. It's an incredible feeling looking at all of those thankful/grateful thoughts accumulated in one place. If you're looking for a more hopeful, positive mindset, I can't recommend this app highly enough.

title: Love this app!
text: I have had Happyfeed for more than three years and I absolutely love it. It‚Äôs an easy way to remind myself to think about what I‚Äôm grateful for every day. I love being able to add photos and now that I‚Äôve been using it for a while, I can look back at the things I was grateful for three or six months ago or one, two or three years ago! It is fantastic for helping me relive happy memories

title: 11 out of 10 would recommend.
text:
I think the app is wonderful. It‚Äôs simple yet such a great tool. It‚Äôs a good resource to help you focus on the positive things in each day. Even on your worst day, just by naming 3 good things can help improve your mood. The 3 good things could be simple, like the weather felt nice outside today. I got to sleep in a little later today. Or I was able to afford McDonalds breakfast this morning instead of cooking or worse, not being able to eat at all. Appreciate the little positive things about life. I love how the app lets you add pictures and a little short entry, but also an emoji you can choose to represent your day. Once your entered enough, it creates these cute slideshow videos. Also, you can join pods and can choose which entries you would like to share or not. You can also create your own pod. For example, I made one called ‚ÄúHappy Girls are the Prettiest,‚Äù which I made for a group of girls like me. Maybe a mom. Maybe someone struggling with depression or low self esteem. It‚Äôs my motivational entries I share in this pod to remind myself & others than inner beauty is worth so much more than outer beauty. 
But anyways, YES YES YES, I Would definitely recommend to all!

title: Can‚Äôt see previous posts!?!?
text:
Overall I love the idea. I‚Äôve been looking for a daily photo journal/ gratitude app. Being honest, I don‚Äôt want to pay a monthly fee to add 1-2 photos and reflect on my day. This app allows me to add up to 3 photos for a day without paying for upgrade. That is awesome!! I love that it gives me little prompts or ideas I could use if needed. 
Downside, I can‚Äôt easily find or read my past entries. I‚Äôm not always great at doing it every day but really try to make sure I have something for each day. I can see my moments from the current week and even the previous week but have to pay for upgrade if I want to see further back or the previous month. That‚Äôs very disappointing to me that I can‚Äôt easily access and see my full month in a view. I have to pay for premium to see photos, memories and moments. Hard to reflect on my gratitude if I don‚Äôt want to pay. I continue to use app for now (it‚Äôs been over a year) but not sure why. 
Side note - I am going through a hard time right now and would love to be able to view previous entries about my dog but unless it was on the same day a year ago I can‚Äôt find them.

title: Why Happyfeed is so amazing
text: Happyfeed is an amazing app it is great for me and my family to spend time together and have funüòÅüòÅ

title: Great app
text: This app just lets you be yourself I feel like you don‚Äôt have to show anyone it‚Äôs like your own person Al digital diary. I love it because I can just come on the app and post MY feelings. You can put the settings on private if you don‚Äôt want anyone else to see, you can also post it for everyone to see which I love! The app can have its downs, but I still rate it a five. When I am sad or just wanna type something, or share something I did that day I go to this app. I live letting people see what I did in the day to have fun, tester I posted and was NOT having fun but that doesn‚Äôt matter! I would 100% recommend this app! It just helps sometimes, or just for fun.

title: Misleading
text: I just wanted a simple photo with journal.  You can‚Äôt use photos unless you upgrade to plus?

title: Two years! 730 days!
text:
Been using this app daily for two years now and I love it! Their customer support is excellent as well, even just for the free version! The free version is complete meaning you don't have to pay for basic use. The upgrade/paid version allows you to do more like export but isn't required for longterm daily use. I am very happy with it and will probably upgrade soon to be able to export but also because I just want to support this awesome app! Definitely recommend!
Pro tip: I read a review once that mentioned a mom who used specific emojis for each kiddo so occasionally she could sit with that kid and search for the positive posts and moments about that specific person! I LOVE that idea and it could definitely be applied to other categories or groups! Enjoy! üíö

title: Don‚Äôt bother if you‚Äôre not willing to pay for it
text: I get not being able to edit entries from past months, but after a month passes, you can‚Äôt even look at the video entries you made back then without paying premium. Just make the entire app cost money if you‚Äôre going to do that

title: New to the app
text: I hate traditional social media and liked the idea of an app that centered gratitude that could be as private or shared as you want. I think this app could take off if they made some slight changes. The premium version should be free to increase user ship. The app design is close but needs to be more seamless and mirror apps like Instagram to help increase use. I hope these things occur and I can convince my friends and fam to leave the other apps!

title: Simple and does the trick!
text: The app keeps your memories so you can reflect on fun things!

title: Best gratitude journal for improving your mental health!
text: I have been using Happyfeed for several years and can honestly say that it is my favorite app. I am an LCSW and see the value in using positive psychology for improving our mental health. Keeping a gratitude journal has improved my physical, emotional and mental health. I love that I can store videos, photos and stories in my daily gratitude journal and my practice has made such a positive impact on my overall being and this is an app that I share with all of my friends, family, and colleagues. On my blog I‚Äôve written about my daily gratitude practice and how instrumental it has been for my mental health and I always recommend HappyFeed because it‚Äôs fun, inspiring and easy to use!

I love happy feed it also helps me with my gratitude journals and my streak is 3 I am abt to be on streak 4 Like OMG I love this app I will tell all my friends about this amazing app because I love it this helps me with my gratuities journal and memories and j can also use it a a diary so I will give this a five 5 star ‚≠êÔ∏è rating . title: Happyfeed
text: I know because it helps share life with you‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•

title: I still love this daily practice
text: I absolutely love this app. If you‚Äôre stressed, you might ignore this on those days, but that is the exact opposite of what you should do. It forces your brain to slow down and find the good in your day. It keeps everything in perspective, and it‚Äôs so nice to look back on past grateful moments and pictures.

title: Gratitude
text: Happy Feed helps me to stop each day and notice the little things, as well as the big things. I have become a more gracious person by engaging in this practice daily.

title: Amazing app for mental health!
text: Love this app so much! Also like I am not always being pestered to buy the paid version. This is great for a mental health check in at the end of the day and nice reminders to keep you happy about previous weeks you‚Äôve had.

title: Great alternative to Instagram
text: I stumbled upon happyfeed while looking for an alternative to Instagram. I wanted to be able to post more for myself than other people as a way to track memories and events. I also got tired of suggested videos/accounts/ads on Instagram. Happyfeed is perfect for what I was looking for! The default of every post is private, but also has an option of sharing posts with close friends. There is a focus on posting/writing about what you are grateful for which has been a cool lens to view posting through as well.

title: The only app I won‚Äôt shut up about.
text: Over 5 years ago I started doing this app when I was going through a messy breakup. This app helped teach me to look for the 3 good things in my day. At first it was hard and after some time it got a little easier. Now, when I have the suckiest of days I can normally come up with 3 good things in my day that are be worth recording. They may not be big but I can find the pockets of joy to be grateful for (sunshine, pretty flower, nice interaction with a stranger, etc). I look forward to recording my 3 good things every night and looking back at past memories (some bittersweet but mostly just sweet). The practice of this app everyday chanced my outlook on life for the better. It may sound corny but it‚Äôs the one app I won‚Äôt shut up about.

title: Delight!
text: I was trying to find something I could upload pictures to, to make a time capsule of delights that made me smile throughout the day. This app does just that. I can decide how and if I want to share with others (pods). And I can look back in a timeline and reflect on what made me happy. This app was exactly what I was looking for, and I can‚Äôt wait to see how far my delight/gratitude journal will take me! 150 days strong so far!

title: My Favorite App
text: This is my favorite way to keep up with my friends‚Äô lives and practice gratitude for my own mental health! I am a licensed mental health counselor and I love recommending this app to clients too.

I love that I can store videos, photos and stories in my daily gratitude journal and my practice has made such a positive impact on my overall being and this is an app that I share with all of my friends, family, and colleagues. On my blog I‚Äôve written about my daily gratitude practice and how instrumental it has been for my mental health and I always recommend HappyFeed because it‚Äôs fun, inspiring and easy to use!

title: I still love this daily practice
text: I absolutely love this app. If you‚Äôre stressed, you might ignore this on those days, but that is the exact opposite of what you should do. It forces your brain to slow down and find the good in your day. It keeps everything in perspective, and it‚Äôs so nice to look back on past grateful moments and pictures.

title: Gratitude
text: Happy Feed helps me to stop each day and notice the little things, as well as the big things. I have become a more gracious person by engaging in this practice daily.

title: Amazing app for mental health!
text: Love this app so much! Also like I am not always being pestered to buy the paid version. This is great for a mental health check in at the end of the day and nice reminders to keep you happy about previous weeks you‚Äôve had.

title: Great alternative to Instagram
text: I stumbled upon happyfeed while looking for an alternative to Instagram. I wanted to be able to post more for myself than other people as a way to track memories and events. I also got tired of suggested videos/accounts/ads on Instagram. Happyfeed is perfect for what I was looking for! The default of every post is private, but also has an option of sharing posts with close friends. There is a focus on posting/writing about what you are grateful for which has been a cool lens to view posting through as well.

title: The only app I won‚Äôt shut up about.
text: Over 5 years ago I started doing this app when I was going through a messy breakup. This app helped teach me to look for the 3 good things in my day. At first it was hard and after some time it got a little easier. Now, when I have the suckiest of days I can normally come up with 3 good things in my day that are be worth recording. They may not be big but I can find the pockets of joy to be grateful for (sunshine, pretty flower, nice interaction with a stranger, etc). I look forward to recording my 3 good things every night and looking back at past memories (some bittersweet but mostly just sweet). The practice of this app everyday chanced my outlook on life for the better. It may sound corny but it‚Äôs the one app I won‚Äôt shut up about.

title: Delight!
text: I was trying to find something I could upload pictures to, to make a time capsule of delights that made me smile throughout the day. This app does just that. I can decide how and if I want to share with others (pods). And I can look back in a timeline and reflect on what made me happy. This app was exactly what I was looking for, and I can‚Äôt wait to see how far my delight/gratitude journal will take me! 150 days strong so far!

title: Easy journaling
text: This app is helping me stick to my daily ‚Äúwriting ‚Äú goal. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve written more than one sentence yet, but the habit is being formed. I also like the random pop up reminders of days gone by! Thank You!!

title: Awesome
text: I just started doing happy feed but it is such a fun thing to write about your day! And when I have pics about my day it just adds up a fun element to this AMAZING online journal.

title: Amazing personal journal
text: The streak feature is what really gets me to write everyday. I want to be able to look back at my life and remember everything. from the minute things i do during the day along side the pictures i take. i‚Äôm in the 500s now. and i can now look back a year and see what i was doing on each specific day. Each entry max‚Äôs out at 560 with 4 photos or one video but you can do up to 10 entries per day. The calendar view is cool to look at as you fill a whole month. If you forget to write. It doesn‚Äôt matter how long you go without writing. If you go on a week vacation and don‚Äôt have time. You get to keep your streak as long as you enter the days in the chronological order. Never skip a day. There‚Äôs also a map view that shows where the geological data of the photo was taken. Cool to see all the places i‚Äôve been. it doesn‚Äôt track you just logs the data in the photo if it even has my favorite feature is the face ID lock. let‚Äôs me feel more comfortable writing more personal stuff in my personal daily journal. Amazing app. I recommend to all my friends

title: Positivity

title: Love this app
text: I have never been able to keep a journal consistently until I started using Happyfeed. It has been so helpful for me to be consistent and to take the time to reflect on my day. Through using this app for about 9 months now I have been able to see the benefit of having the memories of both good and bad days. I appreciates it user-friendliness and how the streak screen continues to encourage you. I would recommend this for anyone who wants to be more consistent with journaling and just needs a place to start. An added bonus is the community aspect and been able to enjoy life and moments with people even when they are far away.

title: Awesomest app ever!
text: I LOVE HappyFeed! I am up to six years and running with my daily memories and I wouldn‚Äôt trade them for anything. I used to feel like I was losing my life due to memory issues; but now, I get to relive my happiest moments every single day. If I go for a day without writing in it, it feels incomplete. Some days, when I don‚Äôt have time to write, I simply use my photos to tell the story of that day. Either way, I am thrilled with the results‚Ä¶memories that I get to revisit over and over again. Thank you, HappyFeed! YOU ROCK!!!

title: A Great App
text: Highly recommend. Journaling is not an easy habit to form. I will buy a notebook intended for journaling, write for a day or three then life gets in the way and before I know it, 5 months will have passed. Then I sit there staring at the notebook and think‚Äîdamn, so much has happened I don‚Äôt have time to sit and journal all of it. Sound familiar? This app (sort of) solved that problem for me. It gives me a prompt, I jot down a few things and add a photo (I like to include photos bc it gives me nice reminders of that specific moment in time). And what do you know, I look back and realize that I have been keeping up with my journaling. It is better than nothing! Give it a try!

title: Happy feed

title: So Helpful

title: Changed my life!
text: Like other reviews, I love this app and feel it has changed my life. I have been in therapy for a long time. I have my ups and downs, but this app has made the quickest improvement in my mood. I love the photo feature! It makes looking at my happiness feed more satisfying, it forces my camera roll to be more joyful, and by the act of taking a photo and looking at them, i get exponentially more joy out of the app/happiness reason. It makes the happiness feel more concrete, tangible, like, look at this real actual moment in time that caused you joy, it is less fleeting than a positive thought, it allows you hold onto the joy more. Because of the app I go through my day really seeking out a positive, which really makes me spend more of my headspace on something good, which has a truly positive effect on my mood. I have only been using it for about a month or two and I started to notice a change a few weeks in. I love the reminders of what made me happy a month ago, I hope over time it will give me notification for 6 months ago, a year ago, 3 months, etc. Normally a month the item is so recent I haven‚Äôt had the chance to forget it. which i guess is good but it would like to get a random reminder of what made you happy six months or a year ago. I paid for the full version and it is entirely worth it. I‚Äôve had days that i didn‚Äôt think were that great but then when I realized I counted up the maximum, ten good things that day, it changed my perspective on how the day went.

title: HappyFeed

This app helps you to make it a regular practice in your day.  I love the option to add pictures.  I also love that you can set a reminder to use the app each day.  Even on the darkest days it‚Äôs important to count your blessings.  üåà

title: The cure for so much
text: This is the first app review I‚Äôve ever written and it‚Äôs because of how important this app has become to me. I swear by this app. It forces me to focus on good things. It helps me remember, which is especially hard as I get older. It requires that I find something to celebrate even when the world feels like crap. It gives me a routine. It allows me to make some moments holy in the most secular of ways. If I‚Äôm having a good time, I stop to take a picture and post it here. If I‚Äôm with someone else, I tell them that I‚Äôm marking a good moment in my life with them in that picture. It makes everything that much sweeter. And it‚Äôs the exact right amount of time to dedicate each day.

title: Happyfeed
text:
I love this app!  A gratitude journal is so necessary for living through our troubled times, for healing or just for living a good life.  This app makes it so easy!  It‚Äôs right at your fingertips every night, it doesn‚Äôt require anything of you but to write 3-5 things you‚Äôre grateful for each day and it keeps track of how many days you‚Äôve written.  It lets you add photos and edit if you wish.  It also lets you go back if you miss a few days.  
Thank-you for this!

title: Loving it
text: My teen daughter (who isn‚Äôt allowed to have social media) and I are both using the app and we have having so much fun sharing joyful tidbits from our days. I‚Äôm hoping I can get more family to use the app so our pod can be bigger but if it just stays the two of us that is great by me.

title: One of my favorite apps!
text: I love that this helps me focus on and remember what‚Äôs important ü•∞ I just upgraded to plus after around 3 months using it every day. Thanks for a great app without ads ‚ú®üëèüèº

title: Finally, a journaling app that works for me
text:
Happyfeed has stuck for me better than any other app like it I‚Äôve tried simply because it‚Äôs so easy to use. I‚Äôm the type of person to get overwhelmed by apps with lots of bells and whistles or ones that expect long entries so this app‚Äôs a perfect fit for me. Plus, recording the good things that happen every day has helped me be more grateful and sets the days apart in my mind so I don‚Äôt fall into a rut so easily. Overall it‚Äôs worked great for me and I highly recommend it to anyone who‚Äôs had similar issues with other apps. :)
As of writing this I have just reached a streak of 300 days in the app. Here‚Äôs to a few hundred more!
